page.title: 16The Colleges CONT
page.content:
It is a{residential college}(which is unusual) with{full}and{part time courses in{agriculture and {horticulture}offered at below{'A' level standard. Most students are on {1 year courses.}A{270 hectare}farm and a 8 hectare agricultural college make up part of the college. There is one {specialist course}on advanced pig husbandry. It is one of only two in the country.
The college has{120 full time students and{350 part time. 10-15%}are {girls. 85%}of the students are from {Norfolk, 10%}from{Suffolk}and{5%}from elsewhere in the{country.}They have 1 or 2 overseas students, but would like more. About{40%}of the{students}are farmer's children.There are{63 people employed by the college altogether.
